pros: CEI has a great culture and leadership!
cons: None that come to mind.

job_title: Geriatric Aide I in Oakland, CA
pros: People employed cares for the participant
cons: Not paid enough for the care we do

job_title: Clinic RN in San Leandro, CA
pros: Helpful to elderly. One stop shop
cons: Own network of providers, needs to expand and give options, understaff

pros: The participants, Co workers, pay, and benefits
cons: HR does nothing to accommodate employees should unexpected health issues arise. The organization cares more allot about profit than quality of life for participants

review_title: Great Mission, not enough staff support
job_title: Lead Social Worker in Oakland, CA
pros: Enjoyed working in a interdisciplinary environment. Felt like I was making an impact in participants lives.
cons: Management and Leadership seemed to lost its way. Always putting out fires instead of investing in staff and working on preventative interventions. Not enough staffing resources. High turn-over.

job_title: Social Service Assistant in Berkeley, CA
pros: Working with the Participants on a daily basis
cons: Salary is low for the amount of work you do

job_title: Social Worker in San Leandro, CA
pros: Great Place to work and great people has great benefits
cons: Need to pay more to obtain there worker

review_title: One of my most challenging jobs
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Key West, FL
pros: The opportunity to enhance the health .and welfare of the elder community with an all inclusive staff.
cons: The commute was tedious from San Francisco to San Leandro

pros:
-Community and mission-oriented
-Positive culture of mutual respect and teamwork
-Employees are appreciated 
-Financially strong with yearly cost of living raises, and bonuses
-Great HR department, orientation
cons:
-Infrastructure in some areas could be improved 
-Depending on the position, some people can have too much workload, can get stressful
-Need more coordinator/administrative assistant positions

pros: CEI is a very mission-driven organization and one that is is very committed to helping their participants live independently and with a great quality of life.. I have a great deal of respect for them as an organization. It is a very team driven environment, which is a huge Plus. Relationships between medical staff, management, and support staff seem to be positive and there's a strong feeling of community. Management is also very approachable, which is another big plus. Very good work-life balance.
cons: Because it's a team driven environment, it may be a challenging setting for people that primarily like to work independently

review_title: Center for Elders' Independence is a wonderful place to work
job_title: Fund Development Manager in Oakland, CA
pros: The staff are so welcoming and kind. It feels like family after awhile. I've been here 1 year and feel very valued. Diversity is very important to this organization, and the mission is an important one.
cons: I personally don't see any.

job_title: Team Lead in San Francisco, CA
pros: Good Benefits around the Bay Area .
cons: Employees frequently ignore the chain of command , this is affecting the morale of the leads, may feel that they aren't respected by their subordinates or the rest of the staff. Many of the directors allow many absences , tardiness, misbehavior to the staff and there are any consequence . And because of this , a pessimistic culture of disrespect and bad attitudes has been created where everyone is doing whatever they want .

review_title: CEI takes care of its employees
job_title: Center Director in San Leandro, CA
pros: Through our work at CEI, we help the elderly stay independent and remain in their homes safely for as long as possible. It's rewarding to help people and their families, especially during trying times like we're going through. CEI employees look forward to building bridges in the communities around the Bay Area.
cons: When one works for CEI, he/she is always available, however it's typically because he/she wants to be

pros: Colleagues were great and well qualified for their positions
cons: Management was poor and there was a lot of turn over with CMO

review_title: Rewarding place to work that serves East Bay senior citizens
job_title: Senior Financial Analyst in Oakland, CA
pros: Rewarding place to work that serves East Bay senior citizens
cons: no major cons at this time

pros: No pros, in my opinion.
cons: Dishonest leadership, working conditions not safe as far as Covid-19 protection for nurses, no training, leadership indifferent to concerns of nurses, pay is very low from what I have been paid in the past. Did not feel valued at all as a professional, experienced nurse. I would recommend looking elsewhere if you want a professional environment and want to be treated with respect and honesty.

pros: In my at time at CEI Iv found more happiness, stability, support, and upward mobility opportunities than ever before. CEI is a supporter of YOU from day one, and they encourage positive growth and change among  all employees and participants. Even though each center is unique in its look and personality, they all believe in the same “treat you like family” culture. From my experience encouragement, patience, and support for everyone is a leadership style that has to start at the top, Linda Trowbridge and the rest of our leadership team are among the best because they train you well enough to leave but they treat you well enough to not want to. I feel valued, empowered, and respected by everyone here and I am grateful to be a part of this team.
cons: There are no cons and they’ve earned that.

review_title: CEI Makes a Difference in the Senior Community
pros:
The people working at CEI are dedicated and hardworking.  I do not work on the clinical side, however, the coordinated care is amazing.    The clinicians, occupational therapists, social workers all make such a difference caring for the senior community.  Their commitment to excellence does not go unnoticed.

Employees are treated with respect, the benefit package is very good.  Employee appreciation events  have been well received by employees and leadership stakes the time to personally thank us.  A variety of training classes are now offered such as Communication Skills,  Facilitation, Emotional Intelligence to name a few.  

Senior Management is approachable and positive.
cons: I don't have any issues with the company, their management or Mission and Vision.

review_title: Mission is the reason to work here
pros: they were mission oriented with the goal to provide severely chronically disabled seniors a safe and happy home with pro-active medical, nutritional, social, and recreational activities to ensure they live as happy healthy as possible. Committed direct care staff
cons: micro-managing at it's finest.  There is very little trust between executive management causing a negative trickle down effect with staff.  The pay is not as competitive as other industries, but you know working for a not for profit this is the way.  huge turn over, no overlap of staff

pros: The people I worked with were wonderful and really loved what they were doing. The hours were nice 8-5.
cons: The pay for regular employee's was horrible, most had not gotten raises in years. The management was the worst I have seen in many years of working in the industry. I have never worked in such an unprofessional environment. The finance department was unprofessional and played favorites, actually screaming and yelling at subordinates in front of the entire department on a daily basis.

review_title: Great mission, good place to work - great work/life balance
pros: Employees are passionate about the mission to support the elderly in our community.   The company provides great work / life balance - and due to expansion  within the organization, there are opportunities for growth.   The Team that I work with is AMAZING, and I know that my contribution to this group is recognized and appreciated.
cons: Sometimes overall communication can be an issue, but the organization recognizes this matter and is working hard to make the necessary improvements.

pros:
Help seniors
If you need a job and put up with a lot of stressful times this is for you then
cons: Unprofessional staff who curse, don't  do their job and make work difficult for others by lying  throwing out documents, improper reporting, dark dim east oakland location, poorly trained management  and supervisors who don't care about employees. Participants have hard times getting help and supplies GA's are unprofessional.  Also to many long term employees who think they run and own the centers, they need to be fired cuz their complacent

pros: Most of the people working here are completely dedicated to CEI's mission helping the low income, frail elderly living independently as long as possible. I am continually inspired by my colleagues, and moved by the high level of concern and professionalism--translating into excellent care for our participants.
cons: CEI is top-down, hierarchical. There needs to be more open communication between upper management and the people who provide direct care to our participants.

pros: The services that are provided for the elderly community from Center For Elders are very much needed in this country. It is a pleasure serving the elderly and making a difference in their lives.
cons: It is a non-profit organization and the salary's are not as competitive as in the private sector.

review_title: Most poorly run place I have ever worked at
pros: If you work in the clinics, your job is probably satisfying.  Clinic folks are nice and caring.
cons: If in the headquarters, total toxic work environment, spearheaded by leadership. If you work there, you can expect disrespect and belittlement; unreasonable pressure to get short term results at expense of the long term strategy; inequity, unfairness, favoritism, injustice;  lack of support;  micromanagement; and morally questionable environments, lack of integrity, encouragement of dishonesty.

review_title: Great mission and positive impact on our seniors & community
pros: While we definitely work hard at CEI, work/life balance is greatly respected and encouraged. Employees are respected and appreciated from the CEO and management. The benefits are competitive.
cons: There really are no cons worth mentioning.

review_title: Great and friendly place to work.
job_title: Social Worker Assistant in Oakland, CA
pros: Diversity, company values, flexibility, growth
cons: not enough translators, more social workers

pros: I love my co-workers which makes it nice to work at CEI.
cons: For me in my department I don't get much on raises.

pros: Very little positive to talk about.
cons: Overworked, underpayied, horrible leadership. Participants are not treated as humans but as a numbers; increase the number to make /save money! High turnover at every level except the middle management and executive level.
